IN CONFLICT WITH.Definition: in disagreement with, different in a way that doesn't allow agreement

ADOLESCENT.Definition: a young person who is developing into an adult, teenager

SEMINAL.Definition: very important and having great effect

PURITANICAL.Definition: very strict in matters of religion and behaviour

ORIGINAL SIN.Definition: the idea that man comes into the world in sin

BAPTISED.Definition: made officially a member of the Christian Church after being covered with water

SALVATION.Definition: the state of being saved from sin

NURTURE.Definition: take care of them and help them develop

NURTURING.Definition: taking care of and helping them develop

WET NURSES.Definition: female servants who would feed them from their breast instead of the mother

AT THE TURN OF.Definition: when one century ended and the next began

UNENCUMBERED.Definition: without having to deal with the

NORMS.Definition: accepted ways of behaving and doing things

SPONTANEOUS.Definition: behaving in a natural, free way

BLANK SLATES.Definition: (translation of 'tabula rasa' from Latin)  blank sheets of paper

WAKING HOURS.Definition: the hours in the day that they were awake

COTTON.Definition: a soft substance from a plant used for making clothes

BREADWINNERS.Definition: members of the family who provided them with money

MORALS.Definition: standards of behaviour and ways of thinking

HOT TOPIC.Definition: a topic that many people talk about

ADOLESCENCE.Definition: the period in which a young person is developing into an adult

TRANSITION.Definition: the process or a period of changing from one state to another

CULT.Definition: group of people with special characteristics

WITHOUT A CARE IN THE WORLD.Definition: with no worries or problems at all

KICKED YOU OUT.Definition: send you out, made you get out

DECLINE.Definition: continuous loss of quality or value

MINE.Definition: a hole or tunnel dug into the earth from which minerals are extracted.

FAIR SHARE.Definition: having more than enough of something

SHORTSIGHTED.Definition: without thinking of what might happen in the future, narrow-minded

WIDER.Definition: including greater variety and numbers of people
